channel.title: How do I check if a certain amount of players are in a certain area?
channel.description: I know how to check if a certain amount of players are online and I know how to declare a certain area. I was just wondering how I can merge both for a minigame to check if a certain amount of players are in a certain area. If you have any solutions please post below. ;)[br][size=1]Posted on: May 14, 2007, 04:59:19 PM[/size][hr]ROFL... Anyone have any ideas?

item.title: How do I check if a certain amount of players are in a certain area?
item.dc:creator: @Java3 Java ™
item.description:
@Java3 wrote:

Hallo 0.o

Creds: 20% to MisterZ for needing this tutorial!

public int checkAllInRange(int smallX, int smallY, int bigX, int bigY) { int playerCount = 0; for(int l = 0; l < server.playerHandler.players.length; l++) if(server.playerHandler.players[l] != null) if(server.playerHandler.players[l].absX < bigX && server.playerHandler.players[l].absX > smallX && server.playerHandler.players[l].absY < bigY && server.playerHandler.players[l].absY > smallY) playerCount++; return playerCount; }

Use in this format:

checkAllInRange(smallerXcoordhere, smallerYcoordhere, BiggerXcoordhere, BiggerYcoordhere);

Enjoy 0.o…

Read full topic
